titleStmt.title: Watson J. Hildreth to James W. Tate
CWG2825

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
EDWD. P. COWLES, JOHN H. WATSON,
HENRY D. TOWNSEND.
290 BROADWAY, Cor. Reade Street
Entrance in Reade,
OPPOSITE STEWART'S.

Law Office
COWLES, WATSON & TOWNSEND,
New=York, June 3rd 1862

Jas. W Tate Esqr
Asst Secy of State
Frankfort Ky
Dear. Sir
Your favor 29th inst enclosing my appointment by the Governor of your State. as Commissioner of Deeds for New York has been received
In accordance with your request. I enclose you Five Dollars -- to cover the Tax -- and also the Oath as required --
For the appointment please accept my thanks

Yours Very Respectfully
Watson J Hildreth.
290 Broadway.

New York
Comr. of Deeds
Oath
W. J. Hildreth
Filed June 6. 1862
